website_summaries.verdict: The Vasque St. Elias GTX has earned a large number of fans in the market owing to its soft cushioning, durable build, excellent grip on slippery outdoor surfaces, and sufficient waterproofing. Also, a lot of purchasers pointed out that this lightweight yet ankle-supportive hiking boot, despite its sturdy construction, took very little time to break in.On the flip side, a vast majority of experts blasted the footwear’s laces for fraying too soon, while a minority of backpacking enthusiasts didn’t like the toe box for lacking enough wiggle room.
pros: Many consumers highlight the gear’s soft cushioning in their reviews
A lot of buyers mention how this Vasque hiker boot, being highly durable, held up well against harsh trail conditions
A large number of wearers laud the excellent traction provided by the Vasque St. Elias GTX on slick, muddy, moist, and steep terrains
Several backpackers are satisfied with how little time it took to break in the footgear
Numerous individuals praise the sufficient waterproofness given by the Gore-Tex lining in wet seasons
Multiple users appreciate the footwear’s lightness despite its sturdy build
Experts quickly took notice of the St. Elias GTX’s remarkable ankle support
Professional reviewers only had applause for the phenomenal stability offered by this Vasque footgear
cons: Some people find the backpacking boot a bit too tight around the toe box
This footwear is criticized by bloggers for having laces that fray quickly
Seasoned gear testers throw shade on the boot’s fragile eyelets

customer_reviews.title: A GREAT pair of hiking boots!
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first pair of Vasque hiking boots about 8 years ago & have logged many, many miles in them. I have a hard to fit size (9-9.5AA) and Vasque is one of only 2 manufacturers I know that makes women's hiking boots in narrow widths. This pair arrived quickly & fit perfectly! I will replace the stock insole with a high-arch version since my low-volume, high-arch feet need additional support (which I do with practically every shoe that I purchase). The style is outstanding & I can't wait to test them out on a wet, cold hike soon!
customer_reviews.author: Joy(euse)

customer_reviews.title: great design, nice function and fashion mix
customer_reviews.text: I'm really bummed these didn't work out, great design, nice function and fashion mix, but they are just too narrow. good arch and ankle support but there's no way that I could hike in these without getting blisters. more specifically the toe box is narrow, I am always a 7.5 sometimes (8 if i want to wear thicker socks) I tried on a 7.5 and an 8 and sadly they were just narrow in the toe box by design. had to return both, smooth and easy refund( and ended up with Merrell hiking boots which were comfy out of the box and took minimal breaking in)
customer_reviews.author: neva

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a size 10.5. I am normally a 10, but I tried these on at REI before ordering them and found I had to get a size up. These are very comfortable and didn't need much breaking in. I wear them all day while gardening just to make sure they are nice and broken in by the time I will use them to go backpacking. Even brand new, I've been wearing them 8 hours a day comfortably. Still, I would recommend trying on hiking shoes before buying them, because each one is so different and it's all about what shape is right for your foot.
customer_reviews.author: Mlize

customer_reviews.title: Five for quality, zero for fit
customer_reviews.text: Love the quality, but alas, I should have paid attention, the boots were way too small. At least a half size and possibly a full size off. I wear an 8 regular and am at the smaller end of an 8, meaning that an 8 always fits, and if anything I might have to lean smaller, not larger. In this case, they are definitely running on the small side. The quality and feel will be amazing once I find the right size! Think I will save the back and forth and try on at a local store.
customer_reviews.author: Beth M.

customer_reviews.title: Great boots
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my daughter for Christmas and she LOVES them...won't take them off. We've been hiking several times in pretty cold temps - 15-20 degrees F - and they are comfortable, good ankle support and warm. They fit perfectly in her regular size and are so comfortable she's wearing them with everything - even casual dresses and tights. She's young and pretty so she can get away with it!
customer_reviews.author: Tomboysuze

customer_reviews.title: Not for wide feet and not very cushioned on bottom
customer_reviews.text: I was not impressed with these hiking boots and I am going to return them. I purposely bought a wide size because I have somewhat wide feet. I was excited to get them and start breaking them in before a hike but I was very disappointed that the pressure on my pinky toes was very uncomfortable. There should have been plenty room for my toes because I purposely ordered the white size. I also didn't feel like they had very much cushion. So after being disappointed I went to Academy Sports and found much more comfortable shoes for half the price. I should have gone there in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: Abby

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! I love these Vasques: my second pair!
customer_reviews.text: My second pair of Vasques (first pair wore out after 20 years). I love these new ones just as much, and recommend them highly. Remember when sizing: order one size up from your dress heels to allow room for proper hiking socks (you probably know that, but better to mention it anyway).
customer_reviews.author: Laura D.

customer_reviews.title: Won't break in
customer_reviews.text: I like that these boots are leather, support my ankles and seem to be indestructible. I most definitely do not like that they have not broken in after several years of attempts. There is no cushion for the feet. After a few miles of hiking in these boots, after I thought I had made a sufficient number of short hikes to break them in, I was hobbling and in extreme pain. I have tried many things with variations of socks and added cushioning and they still result in my feet being in agonizing pain. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CKC

customer_reviews.title: My new best shoe
customer_reviews.text: Starting a new life in the Maine woods. I love these boots. They are strangely comfortable. Didn't expect that! Realistic price for very well made boot. Good traditional classic look. We'll be together for a long time
customer_reviews.author: Claire R

customer_reviews.title: Too wide for me
customer_reviews.text: Had tried on the Vasque Breeze II and liked it, but reviews said it wasn't waterproof so I returned it and bought this St. Elias which runs so much wider that it loses all ankle stability. I even tried adding an insole. I need a sturdy waterproof backpack boot for my narrow, high arch size 6 foot that can take me up a traprock (sharp loose rock) mountainside. Any suggestions?
customer_reviews.author: E. Decormier

customer_reviews.title: The narrow, is anything but.
customer_reviews.text: I bought narrow boots and they are very wide including in the heel. I have searched high and low for narrow hiking boots to no avail. I’m buying some heel snugs meant for ski boots to see if that makes them wearable but will be returning if not. If that does help I’ll update my review.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: I still love the Vasque boots
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing Vasque hiking boots since I was in college back in the 90's. My first pair lasted me almost a decade. I still love the Vasque boots, although the newer ones don't last as long. My previous pair only made it about 2-3 years. But the boots are so comfortable and work so well for me I'll willing to replace them every few years.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Great product. I spent weeks researching shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I spent weeks researching shoes, especially this one. Even visited REI many times and tried it out. Finally I brought it in Amazon. While I am a male, I went with womens size since my feet are very small. I used this extensively on a trip to Tibet and the mountains there ... and they were perfect. A couple of short treks to break in - no blisters at all - when used with thick REI socks ....
customer_reviews.author: S. Gopalakrishna

customer_reviews.title: Runs wide.
customer_reviews.text: Bought because it was a 10N and I wear a 9 1/2 N in street shoes and a 10N (when it can be found) in running shoes and in hiking boots. This Vasque may no longer be made in a narrow so I was happy to find it. It runs wide. It's also stiff so may be able to tighten up when the leather softens up. Still better than most in fit.
customer_reviews.author: Deana Liddy

customer_reviews.title: Too hot because of Gore-tex treatment
customer_reviews.text: This low of a rating is based only on the Gore-tex feature. To be clear, I LOVE VASQUE BOOTS! My previous pair has been trekked into and out of South America and Alaska. The St. Elias GTX pair was returned because they are too hot. I live in Florida and my feet were super hot and the only difference of note was the Gore-tex treatment. If your feet get cold easily or you plan to tromp through water, then you should try these.
customer_reviews.author: C. Butts

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow.
customer_reviews.text: Always loved Vasque in the '80s but these are really narrow on my size 6 feet, that are moderately wide.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Not a Replacement for Vasque Wasatch
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace my Vasque Wasatch GTX boots. Fit not the same nor is it quality. They aren’t the same fit so I returned and paid $115 to resole my old boots.
customer_reviews.author: CAL Forester

customer_reviews.title: Fits runs small, but quality shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I had to send my first pair back because even though i sized up from my regular hiking boots, they were too small. I usually wear 8.5 and was thrilled to find narrow width. Alas, I ended up with 9.5 narrow and fits is good. I may need some heavy socks, but it really is a quality shoe. I recommend!
customer_reviews.author: M. M.

customer_reviews.title: Yes, best value for you buck. Vasque makes good boots (get 1/2 size larger at least)
customer_reviews.text: Good boots, lots of support, good value. Fit a tad small though, consider getting 1/2 size larger, especially for hiking boots b/c you don't want to be hitting your toes against the end of the shoe. Test them on a slope before you go hiking, if they hit the end, go bigger. I have the Vasque Breeze and like them, these are my wifes shoes and she likes them lots.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Well this has not been tested on the trail yet, still being broken in a couple of hours a day, the fit and finish are excellent the weight is superb really like this boot.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Grayam

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent boots. I love that I was able to get them in narrow. They were stiff out of the box as expected from a backpacking grade boot, but they've broken in beautifully. I recommend using sock liners for break in as it'll help prevent blisters. I didn't get any blisters on break in with these. I think I'll have these a good long time!
customer_reviews.author: Just Another Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Construction
customer_reviews.text: It fits perfectly and very durable. Do not hesitate to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Arman

customer_reviews.title: I have worn them in the summer hiking up difficult ...
customer_reviews.text: I have worn them in the summer hiking up difficult trails, and now in the winter on my trip to Iceland. I bought some snow boots for my trip, but took my hiking shoes to give them a try. They worked perfectly and I ended up returning my snow boots.
customer_reviews.author: Magdalena

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, light-weight attractive boots
customer_reviews.text: Bought these boots for my daughter's Utah backpacking week for school. These were her first hiking boots, so we were nervous about having them be her only shoes for a week of backpacking. I should not have worried. They were a terrific fit. No complaints what so ever! They held up great too. The price was reasonable compared to other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great boots, but snug on edges
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots, but am probably going to have to exchange for a size up or wider... I usually fit perfectly with B(M) boots, but my pinky toes have blisters after just one walk in the forest. Hopefully a size up fixes this.
customer_reviews.author: Alanna

customer_reviews.title: This shoe is a very comfortable shoe and the wide was large enough in my ...
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is a very comfortable shoe and the wide was large enough in my toe area which I needed because of foot problems. However I have a narrow instep area and the shoe slipped in the heel area for me so I sent them back. The Vasque Breeze works better for me. Great shoe construction in both the Vasque Breeze and St. Elias I must say.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Neuhaus

customer_reviews.title: Love these boots!
customer_reviews.text: The most exciting feature about these boots was the ability to buy them in narrow! I bought a size and one half up from regular shoes as I plan to backpack in them. They fit well with the layers of socks. I have only hiked relatively short trails in them as I was unsure of the break-in period. They broke in very easily and didn't cause any blistering it discomfort. They provide the ample ankle support that I need. Can't wait to backpack with them!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Wright

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shoes but choose the right sizing!!
customer_reviews.text: Can't ask for any other pair but this one for having great ankle support, good treads (and so grip), and 100% waterproofing. I have been using mine for more than 2 years and it gives me the feeling that this can last a lifetime. Only downside is the narrow toe box. The first one I ordered was a 6N pair, and they were really narrow on the toes. Wearing high socks is also encouraged. I can't last a day without removing these for awhile. Now I ordered a 7W and it's perfect. Still have to try it though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love my Vasque boots
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love Vasque boots. They fit my feet well, they're sturdy and rugged. This is probably my 4th pair. I wear them every day to walk my dog on a trail so I beat them up.
customer_reviews.author: Regina Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Try a half size big
customer_reviews.text: I wasn’t sure if I should size snug or oversized so I tried both a 9 and a 9.5. I am normally a 9. The 9.5 was perfect. Just a slight (finger length) of extra room and it has made all the difference.
customer_reviews.author: Janette Davis

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful Boot - But too tight for me in the toe box
customer_reviews.author: I like pie!

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic hiking boots
customer_reviews.text: These are my absolute favorite hiking boots! They're incredibly comfortable, provide great support and the high-top style protects my ankles. They keep my feet dry from everything but wading right into water - in rain, splashing through puddles and walking through dewy plants. I've done 17 mile out-and-back mountain climbing adventures, backpacking trips and easy day hikes and my feet felt way better than expected when wearing these boots. If you're looking for a solid pair of water-resistant boots, these would be a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn Wright

customer_reviews.title: it felt wonderful. great support
customer_reviews.text: was hard to get foot in without unlacing. once in, it felt wonderful. great support.
customer_reviews.author: tom gordan

customer_reviews.title: The structure of the boot is fine. I'm disappointed in the fit
customer_reviews.text: The structure of the boot is fine. I'm disappointed in the fit, my feet hurt by the end of the day. I wish they were a little wider. The flexibility is poor too.
customer_reviews.author: Garden Goddess

customer_reviews.title: ... nine and noticed that my feet did not feel comfortable. I went and got sized and I discovered ...
customer_reviews.text: I first got the size nine and noticed that my feet did not feel comfortable. I went and got sized and I discovered I wear a nine and a half. When I first put them on they felt as comfortable as my sneakers. I haven't been on a big hike yet but would like to soon.
customer_reviews.author: pleased customer

customer_reviews.title: Great boots, work well on the trail
customer_reviews.text: I have wide feet and Vasque is not known for having wide hiking boots. So I ordered the wide size. Shoulda got the regular size! Great boots, work well on the trail. Waterproof works well too.
customer_reviews.author: Typhon

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty Waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Durable, used daily on farm for a few months, works well.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great support for hiking with good traction. A bit warm for summer as they do not have much ventilation.
customer_reviews.author: Barbosa

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised how well these boots fit. The minute I put them on I realized they were going to be one of the best boots I have ever worn. They are very comfortable with good arch support for me. It always takes a while to break in new boots especially with the high ankle support so I am still taking it slow but so far I love them! I am using thinner socks as thick socks might not work out. These boots are very warm and there is no need for thick heavy socks. My feet are always cold but not in these boots! A nice very high quality boot!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Hill

customer_reviews.title: Awesome but expensive
customer_reviews.text: I loved these. They were really comfortable. The only downsides were the high price and a boot height higher than I like. If they were under $100, I would've kept them.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Doe

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!
customer_reviews.text: I had a fitting done at a local REI store before purchasing and would recommend the same to others. I usually wear a size 8.5 shoe, but at the fitting found that I really should be wearing a 9.5 which is what I purchased. These fit very well and I'm looking forward to many hikes. They look great too which is a nice bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Ebersole

customer_reviews.title: Bad laces
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't able to lace these shoes properly even with alternate lacing strategies. The bottom laces just would not tighten and the shoe never fit right.
customer_reviews.author: CuppyCake

customer_reviews.title: These have been very comfortable for hikes of a few hours in the desert
customer_reviews.text: These have been very comfortable for hikes of a few hours in the desert. With proper treatment, they seem great for snow as well.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: A little narrow
customer_reviews.text: I wish the boots were a little wider. They are making blisters on my little toes. I will have to break them in.
customer_reviews.author: Judy D.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: First day will be painful for your feet. May be even few days. Need to get used to them.
customer_reviews.author: Anton V.

customer_reviews.title: Wide is not wide enough
customer_reviews.text: This Vasque Women's St Elias GTX hiking boot appears to be well-made, and of very good quality. However, I am very disappointed because the wide width is still somewhat narrow in the toe box. The toe guard presses on both sides, the little toe and the joint of my big toe. My feet are just barely a wide. Very sad as only by wearing them for a time does this problem present itself. On the good side, the GoreTex lining does not leak, which is one of the main reasons I purchased them (that and the mostly leather upper boot). It fit's ok in the heel. If you need a boot with a roomy toe box, this is not it.
customer_reviews.author: noupbrm*6

customer_reviews.title: I like the boots a lot
customer_reviews.text: I like the boots a lot, good support, the fit is great. I ordered the narrow and after a year of buying and returning boots because they are always too wide for me, these ones fit great. The laces however are terrible and come undone contantly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are the perfect camping, hiking, backpacking boot on the market!!! They are a little pricey but what are comfortable dry feet worth? I like that I don't have to worry about slipping & sliding & give me a more sure footed feeling then the cheaper boots I've had in the past. I like them so much my husband got a pair also!!!
customer_reviews.author: Didi

customer_reviews.title: The boot is dirty and there are clear scuff marks and abrasions from ...
customer_reviews.text: The boot is probably okay. The problem is we received a used boot. The boot is dirty and there are clear scuff marks and abrasions from the laces. We are will be to return the boot for refund.
customer_reviews.author: G. Reel

customer_reviews.title: I exchanged the boot for the Vasque Breeze and am very pleased with the fit
customer_reviews.text: I have worn Vasque for many of my hikes - from Kilimanjaro to Scotland. This was a new style for me and while the size was correct, unfortunately I could not wear this specific boot because of the height of the ankle support (due to ankle scar). I exchanged the boot for the Vasque Breeze and am very pleased with the fit.
customer_reviews.author: KW

customer_reviews.title: Why
customer_reviews.text: Waterproof great, too wide, not enough eyelets for laces, not like the usual Vasque boots I've ordered in the past, didn't try them on buying online, so it is what it is, don't fit as expected
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these boots
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots. They replaced a 20+ year old pair of 8 1/2 N Vasque all leather hiking boots. These fit the same. One slight caveat and one warning. The caveat is the laces don't stay tied unless I knot them. The warning is the soles were dangerously slippery on smooth, damp man-made surfaces until I scuffed the bottoms.
customer_reviews.author: Philly Filly

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots, narrow feet are hard to fit, so these were a great find! I needed waterproof ones for glacier hiking in Iceland and these seem like they will do the trick
customer_reviews.author: Jen Davis

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: They actually looked better after a 10 mile hike. Scuffing improved the color.
customer_reviews.author: Maryhelen Hagge

customer_reviews.title: Loved it - a little tight
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 9 and bought a 9 and can use these for general hiking. But the lack of room will make all day hikes and longer dangerous for my toes. I recommend a 1/2 size bigger - try them on in a store first if you can.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley L Provost

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these boots! Best-fitting boots I've ever owned and super lightweight and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Narrow boot, not for wide feet
customer_reviews.text: I tried several Vasques, and even the wide is too narrow for my size 8 C/D foot. Probably great shoe if you have narrow feet, but stay away if you have wide feet.
customer_reviews.author: Christine L.

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!
customer_reviews.text: I've been on several backpacking trips and this is my favorite boot by far! My only criticism is that the laces untie frequently. The support and sole are worth it, though.
customer_reviews.author: K. Swenson

customer_reviews.title: They fit perfectly but I haven't hiked with them yet ...
customer_reviews.text: They fit perfectly but I haven't hiked with them yet. Still breaking them in. Will review further after hiking in them so for right now only 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie McNiff

product_meta.title: Vasque St. Elias GTX N/S Steel Toe Hiking Boot
product_meta.description: A sturdy backpacking boot designed to go the distance. Mid-cut offers superior ankle protection. Hardy genuine leather upper for a supportive fit. GORE-TEX® waterproof lining ensures feet stay dry and comfortably cool. Gusseted tongue helps keep moisture and debris out. Plush tongue and collar for added comfort and performance. Reinforced rubber toe rand for extra protection. Molded EVA footbed supplies lightweight support. EVA and polyurethane midsole compounds delivers resilient, long-lasting cushioning for all-day comfort. TPU shank for enhanced support and torsional control. Vasque Exclusive Vibram® Summit outsole with a varied lug pattern for exceptional traction on uneven terrain. Measurements: Heel Height: 1 3⁄4 in Weight: 1 lb 5 oz Shaft: 5 in Product measurements were taken using size 8, width M. Please note that measurements may vary by size. Weight of footwear is based on a single item, not a pair.
feature_bullets: Heavy-duty backpacking performance is lightened up with a weight-optimized Vibram outsole.
